profileText: A Delegate from Virginia; born in Accomac County, Va., in 1731; pursued classical studies; studied law at the University of Edinburgh; was admitted to the bar and practiced; member of the house of burgesses 1772-1774; member of the State house of delegates in 1776, 1777, and 1779; Member of the Continental Congress in 1780; judge of the State court of admiralty 1782-1788; judge of the general court from December 24, 1788, to January 1800, when he resigned; died at his home, ``Fleet Bay,'' in Northumberland County, Va., December 9, 1804.

researchRecord.name: 1778, 3 pages.
researchRecord.description: A photocopy of a letter from John Parke Custis to Henry written on February 1, 1778. In the letter, John Parke Custis directs Henry to pay James Hill the money for the purchase of John Parke Custis's King and Queen estate. Also discussed is the conveyance of the title for the property to Henry. The original letter is privately owned.

researchRecord.name: 1798, 1 page.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Philip Rodrigue to Henry written on March 31, 1798. In the letter, Philip Rodrigue discusses previous fuel distribution for West Point and the closing of the fuel bill account.

parentRecordLocation.name: United States Military Academy at West Point
